title: Comparison of Online vs. Face-to-Face Group Learning Experiences and Development of Collaborative Learning Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and proficiency in social media utilization
context.additional_context: Due to a limited technological environment (primarily smartphones), the use of non-face-to-face collaboration tools is restricted, and most learners are job seekers sensitive to time management.

learning_goals: Learners can present at least three criteria for comparing the effectiveness of group learning in online and face-to-face environments
Learners can complete at least one asynchronous collaborative learning project using smartphone-based tools
Learners can design and implement at least two online group learning strategies for resolving communication issues

resources: Mobile-Friendly Collaboration Platform (e.g., Google Docs, Padlet)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
